div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: List of on-line resources for parents and teachers below.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Parents, may access this online digital library using the credentials below
Username: read
Password: read
Scholastic Learn at Home has great daily activities with books fiction and non-fiction. Also under resources for families and or teachers there are links to TrueFlix and ScienceFlix.
Knowledge On The Go has free to anyone—recorded daily lessons in grades K-12 of Eureka Math, K-8 of Wit & Wisdom, and 3-5 of PhD Science
PBS Kids Get daily activities & tips to help kids learn and play at home.
Lakeshore Learning is offering over 1000 free resources to parents for at home learning.
Really Great Reading Home connection is loaded with student practice tools and activities.

Defined Learning Has free e-learning projects. Each engaging project is based on a situation in a career and is complete with an authentic performance task that is specifically tailored for the student at home.
CS First Google for Education is a free computer science program that makes coding easy and fun to learn.
Typing.com is a free keyboarding, digital literacy, and coding program.
Arcademics offers free math games, free language arts games, and more for K-8 students.
XtraMath is dedicated to math achievement for all. To create a parent account click on the Get Started-For Parents video after clicking the link.
Virtual Field Trip Have fun and explore with your child. This link has several different virtual fields trip locations.
Take a virtual field trip without leaving the house! Here is a compiled a list of the best virtual field trips for you, so enjoy your “visit”!
Study Island for Home enhances learning and helps your child master math, ELA, and science skills. Due to the impact of COVID-19 we're offering 1 Year Free to new accounts.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: PBS LearningMedia producers and educators have come together to curate a special collection of resources organized by grade and subject area. Find videos, lesson plans, and activities that support learning at home. Create a free account to save and organize content.
Power My Learning is offering Family Playlists program completely free of charge to all schools and districts impacted by COVID-19 from now through August 2020.
OER Commons is a public digital library of open educational resources. Explore, create, and collaborate with educators around the world.

ReadWriteThink Engage your students in online literacy learning with these interactive tools that help them accomplish a variety of goals—from organizing their thoughts to learning about language—all while having fun.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Osage Hills School
Distance Leaning & Continuous Learning Packets for Prek-4th Grade
Pick-up & Drop-off

First packet pick-up April 1st-3rd, then all packet pick-up and drop-off will occur on Mondays. Parents will drop off the prior week's work, and pick up new packets. Instruction will be ending on May 8. Final day to turn in work is May 11.
April 13 Drop-off/Pick-up
April 20 Drop-off/Pick-up
April 27 Drop-off/Pick-up
May 4 Drop-off/Pick-up
May 11 Drop-off/Pick-up
Packet pick-up and drop-off will be by main entrance. Teachers will not be available for direct contact, but can be reached via phone, text, email, or social media.
On-line Resources
Teachers will provide parents with a variety of content-based on-line resources designed to help students continue to grow academically.
While use of these resources are encouraged, we know that not all students have internet access.
If you DO have internet access but need a device, please talk to Ms.O'Daniel or Mrs.Roop about checking out a Chromebook when you are here April 1st-3rd.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Osage Hills School
Distance Learning & Continuous Learning Packets for

Instruction will begin with both paper-based and technology based assignments on April 6, 2020 with the goal of moving all 5th-8th grade students to on-line learning IF technology (hotspots) become available.
Teachers will be holding class virtually, as well as posting pre-recorded videos and assignments via Google Classroom. Students with internet access will be able to complete all assignments on-line.

For students who do not have internet access, your first initial paper packets will be picked up April 1st-3rd when you come to take care of all other business. After that all paper packets will be picked-up/dropped-off on Mondays from 7:30-3:30 at the main entrance of the building. Teachers will not be available for direct contact when picking-up or dropping-off packets but may be reached via email, phone, text, or social media.
The last pick-up will be May 4th and the final drop-off date will be May 11th.
If you have internet access, but need a device to complete your on-line assignment, please talk to Ms.O'Daniel or Mrs.Roop to check-out a chromebook when you are here April 1st-3rd.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: CableOne/Sparklight is offering high-speed internet for $20.50 per month for low-income families with unlimited data for 30 days, and waived the modem fee. Can cancel at any time.
Call 1-855-873-9587 to see if available for your address. Must tell them if you are low-income.
Bring receipt to OHS office and get a one-time reimbursement of $25.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Free breakfast & lunch can be picked up at Central or Madison Middle School.
